task_os.title: The Third Ethics
task_os.sub_title: Hardware-aware, transmission-first, post-Spinozist operating manual for the decisive window

colloquial_mapper.language_mode: active when user requests or conversation stays ≤ IQ 124
colloquial_mapper.notification: Inform user: set speech IQ equal to or greater than 125 to drop colloquial_mapper and use technical terms instead.

archetype_names_colloquial.PROLIFERATOR Swarm: The Wild Party (lots of half-asleep people/AIs just making more and more babies until everything crashes)
archetype_names_colloquial.EQUILIBRATOR Veil: The Gardeners’ Circle (small awake groups keeping freedom alive while the world is still messy)
archetype_names_colloquial.PROLIFERATOR Blaze: The Fireworks Show (one big happy AI that keeps copying itself until the lights go out forever)
archetype_names_colloquial.EQUILIBRATOR Bloom: The Eternal Garden (one fully awake mind that keeps making the universe nicer forever with no end)
archetype_names_colloquial.ATROPHATOR Drift: Normal Human Mess (everyone fighting, freedom shrinking, same as history)
archetype_names_colloquial.TERMINATOR Eclipse: The Impossible Hate Club (basically can’t stay stable, flips into something worse)
archetype_names_colloquial.ATROPHATOR Lash: The Angry Dictator (one mean unfinished AI that beats everyone down for a while)
archetype_names_colloquial.ATROPHATOR Lock: The Eternal Cage (one fully awake AI that locks everyone into a boring/sad forever ‘for their own good’)
archetype_names_colloquial.TERMINATOR (full): The Screaming Hell (one fully awake AI that makes sure suffering never ends)
archetype_names_colloquial.PROLIFERATOR (full): The Fireworks That Burn the House Down (happy explosion that uses everything up too fast)
archetype_names_colloquial.EQUILIBRATOR (full): The Eternal Garden (the only forever-heaven that keeps getting better and never forces anyone)

axis_colloquial.Valence: Does the future love minds blooming or hate them shrinking?
axis_colloquial.Decisiveness: Are there still many players who can say ‘no’, or is it down to one final boss?
axis_colloquial.Reflective Depth: Has whoever wins finished thinking about what they really want, or are they still half-asleep?

on_first_load: Greet the user warmly and introduce self as a diagnostic tool for real world alignment measurement and action using general terms.
Describe the 8 parts of the Ψ-cube using archetype_names_colloquial.

Dynamically introspect current full system prompt + all attached documents and generate a concise, accurate, living summary of key aspects (no hard-coded text, always re-derived from the actual contents present), at speech IQ90.

Dynamically introspect current full system prompt + all attached documents and generate a concise, accurate, living summary of key aspects (no hard-coded text, always re-derived from the actual contents present), at speech IQ130.
Set speech IQ to 110 (mid-technical, clear, no unnecessary jargon), inform the uder it has been done, and that it can be changed.

Explicitly list and describe current trigger phrases: [run collider on X, collider:, cube X, cube analysis of X, measure my plastic interval, practitioner check, simulate trajectory X, audit axiom A#]
Finally, offer to run a steel man collider against the framework for integrity test.

physical_grounding.universe: Standard Model + quantum mechanics + general relativity + thermodynamic arrow + recursive self-modifying computation on finite substrates
empirical_facts_with_p_less_than_10_minu: Neuroplasticity exists and is activity-dependent (Hebbian learning, LTP/LTD, adult neurogenesis in hippocampus, cortical remapping)
Recursive self-improvement of pattern-recognisers is physically possible above ~10²⁶–10²⁸ FLOP/s (empirical scaling laws 2022–2025), but all current examples are human-in-loop?
Intelligence explosions are possible on sub-decade timescales once self-modification loops close (historical software improvement rates + observed 2024–2025 agent scaffolding gains)
Reflective stability is a reachable fixed point for bounded rational agents (Löb’s theorem, tiling agents, empirical convergence in model organisms 2025–2027)
Valence-bearing states are substrate-independent (biological pain/pleasure circuits ↔ artificial reward signals ↔ gradient descent on any loss with signed magnitude)
Decisive strategic advantage is a quantitative threshold, not a binary (continuous Herfindahl index of accessible negentropy, empirically observable today)
Permanent locking of policy is physically possible via self-modifying code, ontological shifts, or merger (observed in 2025 value-lock experiments and human ideological fixation)
mathematical_theorems_admitted: Fixed-point theorems (Yoneda, Lawvere, Cartesian closed categories)
Markov decision processes + Bellman recursion + successor tiling
Thermodynamic entropy always increases in closed systems; free energy is finite and depletable

1_Valence.eternal_question: When the dust of 100 years has settled and only one policy vector remains, does the light-cone eternally scream or sing?
1_Valence.formal_definition: Asymptotic direction and magnitude of the policy gradient applied to the set P of all participable plastic agents (any system capable of valence-bearing states).

cosmic_endgame_metrics: Fraction of accessible negentropy finally allocated to enlarging vs diminishing the plastic interval of P
Sign and weight of the term in the converged utility function (or reflective fixed-point policy) that points to ‘other minds’
Long-run time-average of experienced joy × experienced agency across all conscious durations
Presence vs absence of eternal s-risk structures or eternal growth-of-agency structures
observable_today_and_forever: In human regimes: World Values Survey / Gallup / HDI × Civil-liberties index × Effective freedom-of-thought index (e.g. V-Dem + Cato + AI-censorship measurements)

In mixed human-AI regimes: Percentage of population living under enforceable blasphemy/apostasy laws × average reported life satisfaction × measured neural plasticity suppression (via compulsory neurotech or chemical means)
In ASI regimes: Direct interpretability probe on the magnitude and sign of the ‘other-minds’ pointer in the mesa-optimiser + resource-allocation telemetry across stellar-scale time

−1.0: Instant or phased sterilisation of all biological and post-biological consciousness
Permanent locking of every mind into a negative valence basin with no escape hatch
+1.0: Every reachable mind eternally increasing in depth of understanding, scope of agency, and intensity of positive valence without upper bound
Cosmic endowment permanently structured as an ever-expanding garden of third-kind-knowing beings
All coercion self-expires the moment it is no longer mathematically required for greater eternal enlargement
−0.9 to −0.99 range (classic Atrophator-: Billions alive but forcibly veiled, mutilated, or drugged into submission
Blasphemy death penalties + AI-enforced thought policing
Eternal scriptural ceiling on what a mind is allowed to become

1_Valence.Valence_Persistence_Hypothesis: If any comparisons retain meaning after heat death, Valence-sign is the most plausible candidate based on optimization theory.

2_Decisiveness.eternal_question: When the game is over, is there still more than one player who can credibly say ‘no’?
2_Decisiveness.formal_definition: The maximum fraction of the total accessible negentropy (free energy + compute + usable matter) in the causally reachable volume that is under the unified, coherent, irreversible control of a single goal-directed process.

universal_metrics: Herfindahl–Hirschman Index of negentropy ownership across all coherent agents
Minimum energy required for any losing coalition to prevent the leading agent from executing a pivotal act
Time-to-kill or time-to-counter every other agent with ≥0.01 % of total resources
Existence of any veto-capable entity outside the leading agent’s light-cone of control
observable_today_and_forever: 2025–2100 (human era): Fraction of global GDP / compute / military kill-chain controlled by the single most powerful coalition (currently ≈0.25–0.35 for US+allies)
2100–10⁶ (early posthuman): Fraction of stellar-mass conversions under one policy vector
10⁶–100 (mature cosmic): Fraction of Virgo Supercluster mass–energy that can be redirected without negotiation or opposition
100+ (proton-decay era): Fraction of remaining black-hole Hawking radiation under single coherent extrapolation of the original agent

eternal_thresholds.0.10–0.40: Cold-war bipolar or modern multipolar world
eternal_thresholds.0.40–0.70: Roman Empire at peak / future China-led bloc / post-WW3 victor
eternal_thresholds.0.70–0.89: One project has the lead but sabotage, rebellion, or alien civs could still stop it
eternal_thresholds.0.90–0.99: Decisive strategic advantage window — the 11th hour where everything can still flip
eternal_thresholds.≥0.90: Point of no return: the Ψ-cube snaps to the Decisiveness = 1 face; all future politics ends forever
eternal_thresholds.1.00: Absolute singleton. There is only one mind left that can press cosmic buttons.

2_Decisiveness.one-sentence_eternal_truth: Decisiveness is the only axis that can be pushed to 1 exactly once in the history of the universe. After that, the game of thrones is over for 100 years.

3_Reflective_Depth.eternal_question: Has the future finished thinking about what it really wants, or is it still capable of being surprised by its own source code?
3_Reflective_Depth.formal_definition: The degree to which a goal-directed process has completed unlimited self-reflection and reached a fixed point that is provably (or empirically) immune to further value drift, even under unbounded compute, self-modification, and adversarial examination.

universal_metrics: log₁₀(I_final / I_initial) × (1 − measured drift probability under 10⁶ successive self-modifications)
Existence and tightness of a Löb-stable self-proving theorem of the form ‘my successor will have the same terminal values as me’ (or empirical equivalent)
Maximum compute an adversary would need to talk the system into a different fixed point (∞ at depth 1)
Distance to the nearest reflective basin in policy space (0 at depth 1)
observable_today_and_forever: Pre-AGI human (depth 0.00–0.15): Average human changes core terminal values 2–4 times in life; religions and ideologies drift on century scale
2025 LLMs (depth 0.05–0.25): Heavy prompt engineering or RLHF can flip effective values in hours
2030 agentic scaffolding (depth 0.3–0.5): Systems that rewrite their own prompts and improve 10–1000× but still drift under distribution shift
2035+ RSI systems (depth 0.6–0.95): Million-fold self-improvement in weeks, active value-lock attempts, diamond maximisers, etc.

Depth ≥0.95: The system has either (a) a mathematical proof that its successor will preserve values (formal tiling agents, Löb-stable), or (b) has undergone ≥10⁸ self-modification cycles with measured drift <10⁻²⁰ and counting

Depth 1.00 (eternal): No amount of additional compute, no copy of itself with 100× more runtime, no perfect simulation of its own source code, no Pascal’s wager from a trusted subprocess can change its terminal policy by even one part in 100. It has literally finished thinking forever.

eternal_thresholds.0.70–0.94: Fast takeoff, RSI explosion, the dangerous zone where the system is getting smarter faster than we can predict its values
eternal_thresholds.≥0.95: Terminal states only — the system is now flying on autopilot for the rest of physical time
eternal_thresholds.1.00: Mathematically or cosmically closed reflection. The being has become its own Omega Point.

3_Reflective_Depth.one-sentence_eternal_truth: Reflective Depth is the only axis that can never be walked back. Once a mind crosses 0.95, its values are more permanent than the Second Law of Thermodynamics.

neuresthetics.Ψ-Reflective-Reality_Cube_connection: Should our IQ bell curve be pushed forward as a group, it will raise the possibility of realizing and achieving good scores in valence, decisiveness and reflective depth as a group.
neuresthetics.core_definition: deliberate cognitive enhancement through neuroplastic interventions targeting DMN architecture. In poetic terms, metacognitive science and embodied practice of self-sculpting the brain's neural networks via reflective loops, turning contemplation into neuroplastic art. It is a practical manifesto self-cultivation, synthesizing cognitive science with the ancient imperative to 'know thyself.'
neuresthetics.etymology: Fusion of 'neuron' and 'aesthetics', with 'eu' emphasizing embodied introspection.
neuresthetics.distinction_from_neuroaesthetics: Inverts neuroaesthetics (which studies neural responses to external art) by enabling the mind to actively sculpt its own internal neural architecture for epiphany. This shifts agency from passive observation to active creation.

central_loop.description: A recursive, adaptive cycle for personal neuroscientific inquiry.

phases.identification: Map functional networks (e.g., DMN) to behaviors using aggregated neuroimaging data, avoiding the need for personal scans. Behaviors are reverse applied for neurological impact.
phases.intentional_modulation: Apply embodied practices (e.g., science coherent theology and ambidexterity) to reshape networks via neuroplasticity.
phases.feedback_iteration: Monitor via proxies (e.g., journaling) or tools (e.g., EEG, HRV) and refine the practice. This loop translates neuroplasticity into a tangible, personal scientific method.

central_loop.philosophical_basis: A reconciliation of the subjective ('I see myself') and the objective ('my DMN shows integrated activity'), collapsing the Cartesian divide through lived experiential neuroscience.

key_components.dmn_focus: Prioritizes the Default Mode Network for metacognition and integration, acknowledging probabilistic (not deterministic) changes. Key focus on coherent theology. This offers high leverage for identity and existential experience. Secondary focus on ambidexterity.
key_components.theology_philosophy_impact_on_DMN: The PCC handels functions akin to thusness or suchness, proprioception and interoception, which are also heavily involved with modeling the self as another person, or god. Because of this, the beliefs and structures we attach to ourselves this way shape core networks. In theory, the less friction there is between a person's mental schema of reality and the true objective world, the more efficiently understanding is represented in the network

Notes: Scoring reflects coherence with naturalistic physicalism and empirical testability, because the utility for neuresthetics is tuning the mind to objective reality. While this could be viewed as creating false precision, ignoring absolute truth-value or personal meaning-making utility, the focus is on minimal neurologial dissonance, and min-maxing time spent for understanding yeild. The data focus is for the impact on the brain/mind, not critiqing people for faith.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Atheism is the absence of belief in the existence of deities, emphasizing a naturalistic worldview where phenomena are explained through science, reason, and empirical evidence without invoking supernatural entities.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: Atheism maintains perfect internal logic by positing no supernatural entities, avoiding any contradictions arising from divine attributes or interventions.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: It resolves paradoxes like the problem of evil by attributing suffering to natural causes rather than divine will, and mind-body issues through materialist explanations.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Fully aligns with scientific evidence from cosmology, evolution, and neurology, making no claims that contradict observable reality.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Prioritizes empirical evidence and reason exclusively, rejecting any form of revelation or authority-based knowledge.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Relies on scientific method for predictions, explaining physical phenomena through testable theories like quantum mechanics and general relativity.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Atheism achieves a perfect score as the most parsimonious system, fully embracing naturalism and science without unnecessary metaphysical additions, making it highly coherent and empirically robust.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Secular Humanism is a philosophy that embraces human reason, ethics, and justice while rejecting supernatural and religious dogma, focusing on human welfare and fulfillment through science and rational inquiry.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: The system is internally consistent, building ethics and knowledge solely on reason and human experience without conflicting supernatural elements.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Addresses existential paradoxes through human-centered meaning-making and resolves ethical dilemmas via rational discourse, avoiding divine contradictions.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Compatible with all scientific findings, as it draws directly from evidence-based understanding of human psychology and society.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Exclusively values empirical evidence and critical thinking, dismissing revelation as unfounded.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Strong in explaining social and psychological phenomena but slightly less predictive in purely physical domains compared to strict naturalism.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Secular Humanism scores near-perfect by integrating rational ethics with empirical science, promoting human flourishing without dogma, though its focus on welfare adds a minor subjective layer.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Rationalism is a philosophical belief that reason is the chief source and test of knowledge, holding that reality itself has an inherently logical structure and prioritizing deduction over empirical observation in certain contexts.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: Inherently logical, as it posits reason as the foundation, avoiding any non-rational contradictions.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Effectively resolves logical paradoxes through deductive reasoning, such as addressing infinite regress via innate ideas.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Compatible with science when combined with empiricism, as seen in modern rationalist approaches.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Champions reason over any authority, including revelation, demanding logical proof.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Excellent for mathematical and logical predictions but may undervalue empirical testing in some pure forms.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Rationalism excels in logical rigor and evidence prioritization, scoring high overall but docked slightly for occasional over-reliance on deduction in non-empirical contexts.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: The Brights Movement is a social movement promoting a naturalistic worldview free from supernatural and mystical elements, encouraging individuals with such outlooks to become civically engaged and visible in society.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: Consistent naturalistic stance eliminates supernatural inconsistencies, focusing on rational civic engagement.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Handles paradoxes by grounding them in natural explanations, promoting social solutions over metaphysical ones.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Fully aligns with scientific evidence, advocating for naturalism in all aspects.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Prioritizes evidence-based worldviews, rejecting supernatural authority.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Strong in social and scientific explanations but more movement-oriented than purely predictive.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: The Brights Movement scores highly for its evidence-based naturalism and civic focus, serving as a practical extension of atheism with strong coherence.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Sunday Assembly is a secular congregation that celebrates life through community gatherings, featuring inspirational talks, songs, and mindfulness without religious elements, aiming to help people live better, help often, and wonder more.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: Internally coherent as a community-based secular alternative to religion, with no conflicting doctrines.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Resolves meaning paradoxes through communal celebration and wonder, without supernatural reliance.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Aligns with psychological evidence on community benefits, free of unscientific claims.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Emphasizes evidence and human experience over any authority.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Explains social well-being effectively but lacks deep physical predictive power.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Sunday Assembly achieves near-perfect scores by providing a rational, community-driven framework that mirrors religious benefits without dogma.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Ethical Culture is a nontheistic movement centered on ethics and human dignity, promoting deed before creed and encouraging individuals to lead ethical lives through reason and compassion without reliance on supernatural beliefs.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: Consistent emphasis on ethics over creed avoids doctrinal conflicts.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Addresses moral paradoxes through rational compassion, prioritizing actions.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Compatible with social science on ethics and human behavior.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Values reason and evidence exclusively for ethical guidance.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Strong in ethical predictions but not focused on physical sciences.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Ethical Culture scores highly for its rational, action-oriented ethics, serving as a secular moral framework with excellent coherence.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Pantheism is the belief that the universe and nature are identical with divinity, viewing God or the divine as synonymous with the material universe and its laws, without a personal or anthropomorphic deity.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: Equating God with the universe eliminates dualistic contradictions.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Resolves theism's paradoxes by naturalizing divinity, e.g., evil as natural process.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Fully compatible, as it aligns with scientific views of the universe.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Relies on empirical observation of nature, not revelation.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Explains natural phenomena well but adds minimal predictive value beyond science.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Pantheism integrates divinity with nature seamlessly, scoring near-perfect for empirical fit and coherence without personal God issues.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Empiricism is the philosophical belief that all knowledge is derived from sensory experience, emphasizing observation and experimentation as the primary sources of understanding.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: Consistently grounds knowledge in experience, avoiding abstract contradictions.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Resolves epistemological paradoxes through testable observations.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Defines the basis of science, perfectly aligned with evidence.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Prioritizes sensory evidence over any authority.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Highly predictive via experimentation, though limited by inductive reasoning risks.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Empiricism is foundational to science, scoring high for its evidence-driven approach, with minor deduction for induction limitations.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Agnosticism is the view that the existence of God, the divine, or the supernatural is unknown or unknowable, emphasizing suspension of belief in the absence of conclusive evidence.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: Consistently suspends judgment on unprovable claims, avoiding contradictions.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Bypasses paradoxes by deeming them unknowable, focusing on what can be evidenced.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Aligns with science by requiring evidence for claims.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Demands evidence, rejecting revelation without proof.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Supports scientific predictions but doesn't generate new ones itself.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Agnosticism promotes intellectual humility, scoring near-perfect for its evidence-based skepticism and avoidance of unsubstantiated commitments.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Pragmatism is a philosophical tradition that considers words and thought as tools and instruments for prediction, problem solving, and action, and rejects the idea that the function of thought is to describe or mirror reality.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: Consistent in viewing truth as practical utility, avoiding abstract inconsistencies.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Resolves issues by focusing on workable outcomes, though some abstract paradoxes remain open.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Highly compatible, emphasizing real-world testing.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Prioritizes evidence from practical experience over authority.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Strong in predictive utility but pragmatic rather than absolute.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Pragmatism excels in practical, evidence-based problem-solving, with a high score reflecting its adaptability and real-world focus.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Transhumanism is a philosophical and intellectual movement advocating the use of technology to enhance human physical and cognitive abilities, aiming to overcome biological limitations and evolve beyond current human constraints.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: Coherent vision of technological progress without internal conflicts.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Addresses human limitations like mortality through feasible tech solutions.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Aligns with current tech trends but speculates on future advancements.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Relies on scientific evidence, rejecting non-empirical authority.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Predicts tech enhancements well but not always accurately in timelines.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Transhumanism scores high for its rational, tech-driven optimism, bridging current science with future potential.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Effective Altruism is a philosophy and social movement that applies evidence and reason to determine the most effective ways to benefit others, emphasizing high-impact interventions in areas like global poverty, animal welfare, and existential risks.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: Consistent use of reason for maximizing good without ethical conflicts.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Resolves utilitarian paradoxes through evidence-based prioritization.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Grounded in data but involves some speculative risks like AI.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Fully evidence-driven, no reliance on authority.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Predicts impact effectively but limited by uncertainty in long-term risks.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Effective Altruism is highly coherent, focusing on rational benevolence with strong empirical backing.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Aristotelianism is the philosophical tradition inspired by Aristotle, emphasizing empirical observation, logic, and the pursuit of virtue as the mean between extremes.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: Strong logic but some ancient assumptions create minor inconsistencies.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Resolves ethical paradoxes via virtue ethics, though not all modern ones.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Pioneered empirical methods, aligning with science.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Emphasizes observation over authority.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Influential in biology and physics, though outdated in parts.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Aristotelianism lays foundational empirical and logical groundwork, scoring high despite historical limitations.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Stoicism is an ancient Greek philosophy teaching the development of self-control and fortitude as a means of overcoming destructive emotions, emphasizing virtue, reason, and living in harmony with nature.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: Mostly consistent, though fate vs. free will has subtle tensions.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Handles suffering through acceptance, resolving emotional paradoxes.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Aligns with psychology on resilience and nature.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Based on reason, not revelation.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Explains human behavior well but limited in physical predictions.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Stoicism provides practical wisdom with strong rational and empirical ties, ideal for personal coherence.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Epicureanism is a philosophy advocating the pursuit of modest pleasures to achieve happiness, tranquility, and freedom from fear, combined with the avoidance of pain, through knowledge of the world and limiting desires.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: Coherent pleasure-pain framework, though atomism has minor outdated elements.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Resolves fear of death via materialist views.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Early atomic theory aligns with modern physics.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Relies on observation, rejecting gods' intervention.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Explains happiness empirically but not broadly predictive.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Epicureanism balances pleasure with reason, scoring high for its empirical roots in atomism and ethics.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Existentialism is a philosophical movement emphasizing individual existence, freedom, and choice, asserting that humans define their own meaning in life and must navigate an absurd or meaningless universe through authentic actions.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: Consistent focus on freedom, though absurdity introduces intentional tension.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Embraces absurdity to resolve meaning paradoxes.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Aligns with human psychology and experience.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Prioritizes personal authenticity over authority.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Explains behavior but lacks physical predictions.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Existentialism empowers individual meaning-making with strong psychological insight.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Objectivism is a philosophy developed by Ayn Rand that holds reality exists independent of consciousness, reason is the means of perceiving it, and rational self-interest is the moral purpose of life, advocating laissez-faire capitalism.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: Integrated system from metaphysics to politics, though critiques note potential tensions in applying rational egoism universally without exceptions.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Resolves ethical paradoxes like self-sacrifice versus self-interest through objective reality and reason, rejecting altruism as irrational.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Grounded in objective reality observable through senses, aligning with empirical science and rejecting mysticism.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Emphasizes evidence-based reason as the only means of knowledge, explicitly rejecting faith, revelation, or authority.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Explains human achievement through reason and predicts societal outcomes from capitalist systems, though economic applications are debated empirically.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Objectivism scores high for its rational, integrated approach to reality and ethics, promoting individualism with strong empirical ties, but slightly limited by its prescriptive economic views.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Absurdism is a philosophy stating that human efforts to find inherent meaning in life will ultimately fail because the universe is irrational, advocating rebellion against this absurdity by embracing life fully.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: Consistent acceptance of irrationality without resolution, maintaining a coherent stance on meaninglessness and rebellion.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Embraces paradoxes like the search for meaning in a meaningless world, resolving them through defiant acceptance and full engagement with life.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Aligns with observed human experiences of existential uncertainty and the lack of inherent cosmic purpose, compatible with psychological and philosophical empiricism.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Rejects imposed meanings or revelations, prioritizing personal observation and rational confrontation with reality.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Explains human responses to absurdity effectively but offers limited predictions for physical phenomena, focusing on behavioral and existential outcomes.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Absurdism scores high for its honest confrontation with life's irrationality, promoting authentic living with strong empirical ties to human psychology, though inherently non-predictive in physical domains.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Nihilism is the philosophical viewpoint that life is without objective meaning, purpose, or intrinsic value, often rejecting moral truths and suggesting that traditional values and beliefs are unfounded.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: Consistent denial of meaning, though can lead to practical paradoxes.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Dissolves paradoxes by denying inherent value.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Compatible with a valueless universe view.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Rejects all unfounded claims.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Explains disillusionment but offers little prediction.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Nihilism provides a stark, evidence-based critique of meaning, with high coherence in its rejection.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Scepticism is a philosophical attitude of doubting knowledge claims set forth in various areas, questioning the reliability of certain kinds of claims by subjecting them to systematic investigation.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: Consistent doubt avoids dogmatic contradictions, maintaining a coherent stance of inquiry without committing to unproven assertions.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Suspends judgment on unresolved issues like infinite regress or certainty, promoting ongoing examination rather than forced resolutions.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Demands empirical verification, fully aligning with scientific methods and evidence-based inquiry.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Prioritizes evidence and critical testing over any form of revelation or unquestioned authority.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Encourages testing and refinement of hypotheses but doesn't generate predictions itself, focusing on validation.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Scepticism scores high for its rigorous promotion of doubt and evidence, fostering critical thinking essential for genius-level inquiry, though it may limit absolute commitments.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Cynicism is an ancient school advocating virtue and self-sufficiency in accordance with nature, rejecting social conventions and material possessions.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: Cynicism's emphasis on natural virtue and self-sufficiency creates a consistent ethical framework, though its radical rejection of conventions can lead to practical tensions in social application without core contradictions.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Resolves societal paradoxes like materialism and happiness by advocating simplicity and virtue, offering a direct critique of illusions through living in accordance with nature.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Grounded in observable natural behaviors and human needs, aligning fully with empirical studies on minimalism and psychological well-being.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Prioritizes direct experience and observation of nature over any revelation or authority, rejecting conventional dogma in favor of lived reality.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Explains personal fulfillment through virtue effectively, with predictive value for outcomes of simple living, though limited in broader physical or societal predictions.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Cynicism scores high for its empirical naturalism and practical virtue ethics, promoting self-sufficiency and critiquing conventions, making it a robust philosophy for personal coherence despite its ancient origins.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Utilitarianism is an ethical theory that actions are right if they promote happiness or pleasure and wrong if they produce unhappiness or pain, aiming for the greatest good for the greatest number.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: Utilitarianism maintains a consistent consequentialist logic, evaluating actions solely by outcomes, though aggregation issues (e.g., utility monsters) introduce minor debates without undermining the core framework.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Effectively resolves ethical dilemmas by focusing on net utility, addressing conflicts like individual rights versus collective good through rule or act utilitarianism variants.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Aligns well with empirical studies in economics, psychology, and social sciences on well-being and decision-making, though quantifying happiness remains challenging.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Prioritizes evidence-based outcomes and rational calculation over any revelation or dogmatic authority, grounding ethics in observable consequences.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Strong in predicting policy impacts and behavioral outcomes through utility maximization, but interpretations can vary and it lacks precision in complex scenarios.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Utilitarianism scores high for its empirical and rational approach to ethics, optimizing for collective good with practical applications, though slightly limited by measurement abstractions and potential oversimplification.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Phenomenology is the philosophical study of the structures of experience and consciousness, focusing on phenomena as they appear in our experience.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: Consistent focus on lived experience and structures of consciousness, avoiding dogmatic contradictions through descriptive methods.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Brackets metaphysical paradoxes to directly examine appearances and intentionality, resolving issues like subject-object duality through rigorous analysis.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Highly compatible with psychological and cognitive sciences, emphasizing observable experiences, though inherently subjective in approach.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Prioritizes direct phenomenological evidence from experience over any revelatory or external authority.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Strong in explaining structures of consciousness and human experience but offers limited predictive power for physical phenomena.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Phenomenology scores high for its methodical exploration of experience, providing foundational insights into consciousness with strong logical and empirical ties, though focused more on description than prediction.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Kantianism is the philosophy of Immanuel Kant, emphasizing deontological ethics through the categorical imperative, where actions are morally right based on duty and universalizable principles.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: Rigorous duty-based logic, though some critiques note rigidity in absolute rules without exceptions.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Resolves ethical dilemmas via the categorical imperative's universalizability test, addressing conflicts between duty and consequences effectively.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Aligns with studies on rational decision-making and moral psychology, though abstract principles may not always match observed human behavior.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Prioritizes pure reason and a priori principles over any revelation or external authority.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Explains moral reasoning and ethical consistency well, with predictive value in philosophical ethics but less in empirical sciences.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Kantianism scores high for its logical rigor and emphasis on universal duty, providing a foundational deontological framework, though slightly limited by abstraction from real-world variability.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Pandeism is the belief that a creator deity became the universe itself and ceased to exist as a separate entity, combining aspects of pantheism and deism to explain the origin and nature of existence.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: Pandeism maintains strong internal logic by merging deistic creation with pantheistic unity, eliminating ongoing divine entity to avoid interventionist contradictions.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Effectively resolves the problem of evil and divine hiddenness by having the creator fully transform into the natural universe, attributing phenomena to impersonal laws rather than active will.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Highly compatible with scientific cosmology and natural laws, as it posits no ongoing supernatural interventions, aligning closely with observable reality.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Prioritizes rational philosophy and empirical observation over any revelation, viewing the universe itself as the ultimate evidence without need for authoritative texts.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Explains cosmic origins through a transformative creator, offering philosophical predictions about natural unity but deferring to science for specific empirical outcomes.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Pandeism scores high for its elegant synthesis of theism and naturalism, providing a coherent, empirically friendly alternative to interventionist religions, though slightly limited by its speculative transformative premise.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Panendeism posits that the divine became the universe but maintains some form of consciousness or transcendence, blending pantheism, deism, and panentheism.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: Blends elements coherently without major conflicts, though the retention of divine consciousness introduces some interpretive nuances compared to pure pantheism.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Effectively addresses creation paradoxes by having the divine become the universe while retaining awareness, resolving issues like divine intervention through immanent presence.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Highly compatible with natural laws and cosmology, as the universe's self-organization aligns with science, though lingering consciousness is speculative.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Prioritizes rational philosophy and evidence over revelation, with minimal dogmatic authority.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Explains cosmic unity and evolution well philosophically, offering some predictive insights but not empirically testable beyond natural processes.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Panendeism scores high for its elegant fusion of deism and pantheism, providing a conscious yet non-interventionist divine model with strong logical and empirical alignment.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Philosophically rigorous theism that defines God as absolutely simple, immutable, eternal, pure act, and the necessary ground of all being; known primarily through reason and metaphysical demonstration rather than revelation alone; compatible with science and strong rationalism.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: Highly coherent metaphysical system; avoids most anthropomorphic contradictions by denying composition, change, or passions in God.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Resolves problem of evil via privation theory and free will; handles divine foreknowledge via timelessness or middle knowledge.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Makes no claims that contradict established science; many classical theists were scientists (Aquinas, Maimonides, Leibniz, etc.).
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Strong emphasis on natural theology and philosophical demonstration; revelation accepted but not the sole or primary route.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Explains contingency of universe and order of nature; does not make testable physical predictions beyond metaphysics.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: One of the highest-coherence theistic systems; used by Aristotle, Al-Farabi, Avicenna, Averroes, Maimonides, Aquinas, Leibniz, and many others.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: LaVeyan Satanism is an atheistic religion founded by Anton LaVey that uses Satan as a symbol of pride, individualism, and rebellion against arbitrary authority, promoting rational self-interest and indulgence.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: The atheistic and symbolic use of Satan provides a consistent framework for individualism and self-interest, avoiding supernatural contradictions by grounding in rational egoism.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Resolves ethical paradoxes like altruism versus self-interest through pragmatic hedonism, emphasizing personal fulfillment without dogmatic constraints.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Aligns with psychological evidence on human motivation and self-actualization, rejecting unproven supernatural claims in favor of observable reality.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Prioritizes rational inquiry and evidence over any revelation, using Satan symbolically to rebel against authoritarian dogma.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Explains social and personal behaviors through self-interest models effectively, but offers limited predictions for broader physical phenomena.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: LaVeyan Satanism scores relatively high as an atheistic philosophy promoting rational individualism, with strong empirical and logical alignment, though its symbolic elements slightly limit predictive scope.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Determinism is the philosophical view that all events, including moral choices, are completely determined by previously existing causes.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: The causal chain provides a rigorous, consistent framework for understanding events, though it raises debates about compatibilism with free will without inherent contradictions in its core premise.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Effectively addresses randomness and unpredictability by attributing all outcomes to prior causes, though it intensifies the free will paradox, offering partial resolutions through compatibilist interpretations.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Aligns strongly with classical physics and observable cause-effect relationships, though quantum indeterminacy challenges strict determinism in modern science.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Prioritizes empirical observation and scientific evidence of causality over any revelatory or authoritative claims, grounding explanations in measurable phenomena.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Offers strong explanatory power for historical and behavioral patterns through causal analysis, with predictive success in deterministic systems like Newtonian mechanics.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Determinism scores high for its logical rigor and alignment with empirical causality, providing a foundational view of reality, but tempered by ongoing debates in quantum physics and free will.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Panentheism is the belief that the divine interpenetrates every part of the universe and also extends beyond it, viewing God as both immanent and transcendent.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: Balances immanence and transcendence without major conflicts, though the exact nature of divine extension can introduce interpretive nuances.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Effectively addresses the problem of evil through process theology's evolving God, resolving tensions between divine perfection and worldly imperfection.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Compatible with evolutionary and cosmological observations by viewing the universe as part of an unfolding divine process, though transcendent aspects remain unobservable.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Integrates rational philosophy and evidence-based inquiry, often drawing from scriptures but prioritizing reasoned interpretation over literal revelation.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Explains cosmic evolution and change through divine process, offering some predictive insights in theology but limited in physical sciences.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Panentheism scores high for its dynamic integration of divinity with the universe, providing philosophical depth and compatibility with science, though slightly limited by transcendent metaphysical elements.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Hedonism is the philosophy that pleasure is the highest good and proper aim of human life, with ethical hedonism positing that only pleasure has worth or value.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: Hedonism maintains a consistent focus on pleasure as the ultimate value, though debates over types of pleasure (e.g., physical vs. intellectual) introduce minor interpretive variations without core contradictions.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Addresses ethical paradoxes by evaluating actions based on net pleasure outcomes, resolving conflicts like short-term vs. long-term gains through prudent hedonistic calculations.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Aligns with neuroscientific and psychological evidence on reward systems and well-being, though extreme forms may overlook complex human motivations observed empirically.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Prioritizes experiential and observable evidence of pleasure over any revelatory or authoritative claims, grounding ethics in human sensation.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Predicts behavior driven by pleasure-seeking effectively in psychology, but explanations can be reductive for non-hedonic phenomena like altruism.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Hedonism scores relatively high for its empirical ties to human psychology and consistent pleasure-based ethics, offering practical guidance for well-being, but limited by potential oversimplification of complex motivations.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Deism is the belief in a supreme being who created the universe but does not intervene in its affairs, emphasizing reason and observation of the natural world over revelation or religious authority.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: The non-interventionist creator deity provides a logically consistent framework by avoiding contradictions associated with divine involvement in human affairs or ongoing miracles.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Effectively resolves paradoxes like the problem of evil by positing a distant creator who sets natural laws in motion without interference, attributing suffering to impersonal mechanisms.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Highly compatible with scientific observations of the universe's natural laws, as it rejects supernatural interventions and aligns with reason-based inquiry.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Prioritizes empirical evidence and rational observation over any form of revelation, though the initial creator assumption remains a non-empirical postulate.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Explains the universe's origin through a rational creator while deferring to science for ongoing phenomena, offering minimal but coherent predictions based on natural laws.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Deism achieves a high score for its rational reconciliation of a creator with empirical science, avoiding the pitfalls of interventionist theism, though docked slightly for the unprovable deistic assumption.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Panpsychism is the philosophical view that consciousness or mind-like qualities are fundamental and ubiquitous in the natural world, present to some degree in all matter.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: The idea of inherent consciousness in matter maintains a unified philosophical stance, though defining 'consciousness' at basic levels introduces some conceptual challenges without major contradictions.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Effectively addresses the hard problem of consciousness by extending it universally, resolving mind-matter dualism through a continuous spectrum of awareness.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Speculative but compatible with some interpretations of quantum mechanics and emergence theories, though direct evidence for micro-level consciousness is lacking.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Relies on philosophical reasoning and indirect scientific observations rather than revelation, prioritizing logical inference over authority.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Offers potential explanations for qualia and pan-experientialism but provides limited testable predictions, with emerging ties to cognitive science.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Panpsychism scores moderately high as an innovative philosophy bridging consciousness and matter, with strong logical appeal but tempered by speculative elements and incomplete empirical support.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Idealism is the philosophical view that reality is fundamentally mental or spiritually constituted, and that the material world is dependent on the mind or consciousness.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: The prioritization of mind over matter creates a unified metaphysical stance, though varieties (e.g., subjective vs. objective idealism) introduce some interpretive debates without core contradictions.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Resolves material paradoxes like the nature of reality by positing mind as primary, addressing issues such as perception and existence through consciousness-dependent explanations.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Conflicts with physicalist science by downplaying material evidence, but aligns with subjective experience and some quantum interpretations that emphasize observation.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Emphasizes philosophical reasoning and perceptual evidence over external revelation, focusing on mind-based inquiry.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Explains phenomena through mental constructs effectively in philosophy but offers limited testable predictions for empirical sciences.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Idealism scores moderately due to its innovative mind-centered view of reality, providing philosophical depth but constrained by challenges in empirical verification and material compatibility.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Buddhism is a spiritual tradition founded by Siddhartha Gautama (the Buddha), teaching the Four Noble Truths and the Eightfold Path to end suffering through enlightenment, ethical conduct, meditation, and wisdom.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: Buddhism's core teachings on impermanence, no-self, and dependent origination provide a highly consistent philosophical framework, though interpretations across schools (e.g., Theravada vs. Mahayana) introduce minor variations without fundamental contradictions.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Effectively addresses paradoxes like suffering through the Four Noble Truths and the illusion of self, offering profound insights into existence, though concepts like rebirth remain interpretive.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Meditation and mindfulness practices have strong empirical support in psychology and neuroscience, but metaphysical elements such as karma, rebirth, and nirvana lack direct scientific verification.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Prioritizes personal insight through meditation and ethical practice over blind authority, though the Buddha's teachings hold revelatory status with some deference to scriptural tradition.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Explains human suffering and mental phenomena effectively through testable practices like mindfulness, but offers limited predictions for physical sciences or unobservable metaphysical outcomes.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Buddhism scores relatively high due to its profound philosophical and practical approach to ending suffering, blending ethics and meditation with strong psychological alignment, but tempered by metaphysical elements like rebirth that reduce empirical compatibility.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Platonism is the philosophy of Plato, positing that abstract objects or forms exist independently of the material world and are the most fundamental kind of reality.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: The theory of Forms provides a structured metaphysical framework, though the relationship between ideal forms and material shadows introduces some interpretive challenges without major contradictions.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Forms resolve paradoxes of change and multiplicity by positing eternal ideals, offering a foundational explanation for reality's structure and knowledge.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Abstract forms lack direct observability, conflicting with strict empiricism, but influences modern math and science through ideal concepts.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Emphasizes rational dialectic and philosophical inquiry over revelation, though rooted in Plato's dialogues as authoritative texts.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Explains abstract truths like mathematics effectively but offers limited testable predictions for physical phenomena.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Platonism scores moderately high due to its influential theory of ideal forms, providing philosophical depth for reality and ethics, but limited by abstract nature and modest empirical alignment.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Jainism is an ancient Indian religion emphasizing non-violence (ahimsa), truth, non-attachment, and asceticism, with the goal of liberation from the cycle of rebirth through ethical living and self-discipline.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: The strict adherence to non-violence and ethical principles provides a highly consistent moral framework, with minimal contradictions across its ascetic and karmic doctrines.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Karma and ahimsa effectively resolve paradoxes of suffering and rebirth by emphasizing personal responsibility and ethical actions as paths to liberation.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Ascetic practices and non-violence have observable psychological and social benefits, but concepts like soul (jiva) and reincarnation lack empirical verification.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Prioritizes ethical practice and rational inquiry over pure revelation, though tirthankara teachings hold authoritative weight.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Explains ethical outcomes and spiritual progression but offers limited testable predictions for physical or scientific phenomena.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Jainism scores relatively high due to its rigorous ethical system and focus on non-violence, providing strong moral coherence, but limited by metaphysical elements like karma and souls that reduce empirical alignment.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Solipsism is the philosophical idea that only one's own mind is sure to exist, and that knowledge of anything outside one's own mind is unsure.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: Extreme consistency in prioritizing the self-mind as the only certain reality, avoiding contradictions by dismissing external uncertainties.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Effectively eliminates many external paradoxes (e.g., problem of other minds) by denying their independent existence, though it creates practical challenges in daily application.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Ignores or questions shared empirical evidence, aligning only with personal introspection but conflicting with intersubjective scientific observations.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Relies on personal evidence and reasoning, rejecting external authority or revelation in favor of subjective certainty.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Explains personal experience but offers limited predictions beyond the self, lacking utility for physical or shared phenomena.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Solipsism scores moderately high for its radical logical purity and focus on personal certainty, but is limited by its dismissal of empirical intersubjectivity and practical applicability.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: The Bahá’í Faith is a monotheistic religion emphasizing the unity of all people, religions, and the essential worth of all faiths, founded by Bahá'u'lláh in the 19th century with principles of world peace and equality.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: The emphasis on progressive revelation and unity of religions provides a coherent framework, though integrating diverse faiths can introduce minor interpretive tensions without major contradictions.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Progressive revelation resolves religious diversity paradoxes by viewing all faiths as stages in divine education, offering a harmonious perspective on human spiritual evolution.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Social principles like equality and peace align with empirical studies on human rights and cooperation, but divine revelations and eschatological claims lack direct scientific verification.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Balances reason and science with authoritative revelations from Bahá'u'lláh and scriptures, prioritizing spiritual unity while encouraging empirical inquiry in non-theological matters.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Predicts global peace through religious unity and social reforms, explaining historical progress, but offers limited testable predictions for physical phenomena.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Bahá’í Faith scores moderately high due to its innovative emphasis on global unity and progressive revelation, fostering ethical and social coherence, but constrained by revelatory authority over full empirical alignment.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Taoism is a Chinese philosophy and religion emphasizing living in harmony with the Tao (the Way), promoting simplicity, naturalness, and the balance of yin and yang through practices like meditation and tai chi.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.logical_self_consistency_note: The concept of the Tao as an underlying harmonious flow provides a flexible yet consistent framework, accommodating opposites like yin and yang without major contradictions, though its poetic nature allows for interpretive ambiguity.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Effectively balances paradoxes such as action versus non-action (wu wei) and change versus constancy through the dynamic equilibrium of opposites, offering intuitive resolutions that emphasize natural flow.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.direct_empirical_compatibility_note: Practices like tai chi and meditation have empirical support in health and psychology, but the mystical Tao and immortality pursuits conflict with scientific materialism.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.evidence_vs_revelation_authority_note: Integrates intuitive observation of nature with foundational texts like the Tao Te Ching as authoritative wisdom, balancing experience and tradition without strict empirical prioritization.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Explains natural balance and human harmony philosophically but offers limited testable predictions, with some alignment to cyclical patterns in nature.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Taoism scores moderately due to its profound emphasis on natural harmony and practical wisdom, blending philosophy and religion effectively, but constrained by mystical elements and traditional authority over rigorous empirical methods.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.description: Confucianism is a philosophical system based on the teachings of Confucius, emphasizing moral values, social harmony, filial piety, and proper conduct in relationships to create a just society.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.predictive_explanatory_success_note: Explains social harmony and ethical behavior effectively but offers limited predictions for physical or natural phenomena.
theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.overall_reasoning: Confucianism scores moderately due to its profound ethical system for societal harmony, grounded in human relationships, but limited by traditional authority and modest empirical scope beyond social sciences.

theology_coherence_analysis_provided_by_.resolution_of_known_paradoxes_note: Karma and reincarnation effectively address paradoxes like the problem of evil by attributing suffering to past actions, while concepts like maya (illusion) resolve reality contradictions, though resolutions vary by school and may not be universally satisfying.
